group_1.textLeft: Um... So, what you're saying, is...?

group_1.narration: "It's true that you were in an accident,@but it was actually just a scrape."

group_1.textLeft: So it was all Mom's misunderstanding...?

group_1.textRight: ...Thinking back, the caller's@tone was somewhat light...
But they mentioned something@about an ambulance, so I thought...

group_1.textLeft: No, you see, I did fall and bang my head,@but it wasn't anything serious.
The driver called an ambulance for me,@just to be careful,
and I suppose that must have been@when he called you, too.
But in any case, they gave me an examination,
and there aren't any complications,@it really is just a very minor injury.
Apparently they do want me to come back@for a follow-up appointment, though.
...I'm sorry to have given you a fright.
It seems there was a miscommunication and@you thought I'd been hurt pretty badly...
So that's all it was...@Just from jumping to conclusions...
[chara:800700:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]H-hey now...@You don't have to cry about this...
Ah... I'm sorry too, for making you worry.
I was being obstinate, I should've called you myself.
...And I'm sorry for worrying both of you.

group_1.textCenter: No, you're fine, we were the ones at fault there.

group_1.textLeft: Well then, for now...how about we all head home?
...Weren't you two just in the@middle of a fight earlier?
Did that get settled?
...Not that I want you to fight, it's just...

group_1.textRight: ...Ah, I get it. I guess it's natural you'd think that.
Honestly, most of the things we@fight about are pretty insignificant.
We may not always agree with each other,@but at the end of the day we're still a family.

group_1.textLeft: So, you're saying that, the more you fight@the better you get along, or something?

group_1.textRight: Hmm... That's not quite right either, I think...
Your father and I certainly don't hate each other.
It's a bit embarrassing to say out loud,
but we're currently a bit too close@for how much we love each other.

group_1.textLeft: Mind you, we once loved each other@at close range, as lovers.
But now a little distance puts our love for@each other in a more considerate light.
This is something that your mother and@I only figured out recently, though.
I was sure that you just didn't@love each other anymore...

group_1.textRight: Rather, it's precisely because we love each@other that we can talk things out.
For instance, we've been discussing the idea@of living separately after you move out...

group_1.textLeft: What...?
